intro: Thelymitra sanscilia, commonly known as the pink rain orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its erect, grass-like foliage and produces striking pink or purple flowers during the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its flowers are borne on slender stems and are often clustered in loose inflorescences. Thelymitra sanscilia is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its delicate, ephemeral blooms.
